p: Given the significant problems caused by these fungi in the cultivation of blueberry, the use of plant extracts from medicinal plants has been considered as a control alternative [ 30]. This study shows that extracts of L. hirta, A. ochroleuca and A. Porophyllum have antifungal activity in vitro. Among the best treatments, the inhibitory effect (100%) of the extract M5L (AcOEt) of L. hirta on P. Clavispora and C. gloeosporioides was most prominent. Another study showed that extracts of other species of the same genus ( L. camera) have an antifungal effect against F. oxysporum but not against C. gloeosporioides [ 8]. We found no reports on the antifungal effect of extracts of L. hirta against these or other pathogens of blueberry.
